net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends Object
    A Timer object calls tasks to be executed at a specified time and/or interval.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    MIWTSession.addTimer(Timer)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timer(long delay)
      A "single-shot" timer active after the specified delay.
      Timer(long delay, long period)
      Creates a timer object.
      Timer(long delay, long period, long iterations)
      Creates a timer object that expires for the specified number of iterations after a delay and at an interval.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addActionListener(ActionListener action)
      Adds an ActionListener to the list of tasks to be called when the timer expires.
      void fireActions()
      Fires any actions registered with the timer.
      long getCurrentIteration()
      Gets the current iteration count.
      long getStartTime()
      Return the time that this timer was started.
      long getTotalIterations()
      Gets the number of iterations this timer will perform before expiring.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns false if the timer has been stopped or is past the number of iterations set.
      long next()
      Fires any actions if the timer has expired.
      void removeActionListener(ActionListener action)
      Removes an ActionListener from the list of tasks to be called when the timer expires.
      void setPeriod(long period)
      Sets the period of expiration for the timer.
      void setTotalIterations(long iterations)
      Sets the number of iterations this timer will perform before expiring 0 is the default value.
      void start()
      Starts the timer.
      void stop()
      Stops the timer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer(long delay)
        A "single-shot" timer active after the specified delay. It expires once.
        Parameters:
        delay - The amount of delay (in milliseconds) before the object is enabled.

      • Timer

        public Timer(long delay,
     long period)
        Creates a timer object.
        Parameters:
        delay - The amount of delay (in milliseconds) before the object is enabled.
        period - An interval in milliseconds.

      • Timer

        public Timer(long delay,
     long period,
     long iterations)
        Creates a timer object that expires for the specified number of iterations after a delay and at an interval. Timer starts immediately.
        Parameters:
        delay - The amount of delay (in milliseconds) before the object is enabled.
        period - An interval in milliseconds.
        iterations - The number of times the object expires and fires any actions

    • Method Detail

      • addActionListener

        public void addActionListener(ActionListener action)
        Adds an ActionListener to the list of tasks to be called when the timer expires.
        Parameters:
        action - the ActionListener to add.

      • fireActions

        public void fireActions()
        Fires any actions registered with the timer.

      • getCurrentIteration

        public long getCurrentIteration()
        Gets the current iteration count.
        Returns:
        the current iteration count.

      • getStartTime

        public long getStartTime()
        Return the time that this timer was started. If the timer is stopped or has not been started yet the return value is -1.
        Returns:
        The time the timer was started or -1.

      • getTotalIterations

        public long getTotalIterations()
        Gets the number of iterations this timer will perform before expiring.
        Returns:
        the number of iterations. 0 if infinite.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns false if the timer has been stopped or is past the number of iterations set.
        Returns:
        True if the timer is running.

      • next

        public long next()
        Fires any actions if the timer has expired.
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds till the timer expires or -1 if the timer is disabled.

      • removeActionListener

        public void removeActionListener(ActionListener action)
        Removes an ActionListener from the list of tasks to be called when the timer expires.
        Parameters:
        action - the ActionListener to remove.

      • setPeriod

        public void setPeriod(long period)
        Sets the period of expiration for the timer.
        Parameters:
        period - An interval in milliseconds.

      • setTotalIterations

        public void setTotalIterations(long iterations)
        Sets the number of iterations this timer will perform before expiring 0 is the default value.
        Parameters:
        iterations - the number of iterations. 0 if infinite.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the timer.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the timer.
